I didn't sleep for a 4 day span, and now sleep on and off an hour at a time. My thinking is still foggy from the Kratom, but it doesn't do much in regards to anxiety. Right now I imagine that the benzo W/Ds are still most of it

I had no idea it would be so intense after 2 weeks. I only sleep hour stints, last week I was up for 4 days straight. Everything bothers me... Going outside feels so terrifying, esp when I am physically shaking and in constant cold sweats.

The first two weeks were absolutely brutal, I could barely function, I didn't sleep for a 4 day span, I was extremely paranoid, it truly was hell. I thought the benzo withdrawals kicked in that first week but now that I look back I think it was primarily opiate withdrawals.
recent withdrawal. I was on a large benzo/opiate habit and got off both 3 weeks to the day. The withdrawal was really intense

can't handle the wrestless legs at night
I still haven't had the withdrawals I was expecting, no shitting water, no puking, no seizures (from benzo wd), no sweats
Now that I am clean, I can barely get out of bed bc back and knees are so bad
I am scared bc I know I am going to be in pain
Still having restless legs, but my regular Dr says they're not related, which means that the only withdrawal symptom I had was insomnia

I have been taking kratom since Tuesday to help withdrawal
Either way... only 3-4 hours of sleep last night. Forced down a small meal and vitamins this morning.

Day 3 was a mixed bag. Few emotional spells, morning GI subsided, worked 9 hours, small gym session, little marijuana, fair amount of food, 5.5 hours of sleep. Dropping the Lope to 6mg today, plan on working out after work, dropping the Benzo to .25mg today and .75mg tonight before bed.
Waking up to day 7. Sleep was total shit and so is this morning. Right now feels so discouraging.
One week down, working on day 8. So far I haven't been a huge crybaby like yesterday. Instead it's just a emotional void, no good or bad. I'll take that over just bad.
Still have the morning GI lingering around but the malaise is still the biggest pain in the ass
I still cry like a baby sometimes but less frequently. I still blow up the bathroom in the morning but it doesn't persist all day. I still can't sleep well but I'm grabbing more random spurts of it.
the worst the GI has been since day 6-7
Still having gnarly morning GI that tapers off. Still can't totally relax without some restless feet. Lingering anhedonia that comes in waves.
GI is still a little weird but subsides after 2 morning trips. Restless in the evening, or whenever I lay down in general, but I'm sleeping 5-6.5 hours with a melatonin and unisom
Two morning GI episodes. Only really annoying thing left from the physical side is clammy hands, feet, pits.
a few cases of the clammy sweats
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits, anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs
Felt like day 4 of withdrawals out of the blue
Only things lingering around at 25 days are morning GI, restless sleep, anxiety/anhedonia waves
My body/brain are feeling anxious, depressed and just out of sync compared to 27-30. Almost feels like days 7-11 again.
four days. can't sleep. but I'm happy I've gone this long. I feel so much better than I thought I would. I have an appetite.
I have been off heroin for six days now
Achy. Zero sleep. But I feel so much better than just yesterday.
Im still only a few days clean
Grinding. Getting well. Got some Fucking sleep! This is the longest I've been sober in a year at least.
Seven days. One week. I've made it this far.

I was in absolutel agony, I literally layed in the shower crying for like 12 hours, every inch of my body hurt, migraines, sweating like a dog even though my condo was 62 degrees, throwing up, I was so tired but couldn't even lay on my bed because the RLS would start up instantly.
Yet as much as we hate it, it's important to be prepared. I've seen people post their WD kits before. So what's in yours?
But, truth be told - my withdrawl isn't anywhere near what I've seen in others. Bone pain and exhaustion is about it.

I've got 4 months clean and sober - the idea of being in pain just riles me up. I know that there is no chance in hell that I can have any opiates without coming unhinged. I'm already having that phantom pain that gets my brain ready for some warm fuzzies...

I've been meaning to quit for a while, but couldn't take time off work to get clean. I had once mega dosed on Lope when I couldn't get seeds, and while it was miserable it did trade ~80% of W/D symptoms, for a aching upset stomach, but no vomiting, which was key for me.

Had real bad nausea last night, wasn't really anywhere near puking just, felt queasy.  And I was wide awake until ~6am when I got REAL tired.  Great I thought finally some sleep WRONG, brain said perfect timing for some R....L.....S!!!
11 days since I quit a daily PST habit of 2 1/2 pounds a day for about 2 years. I'm having a few potential issues I'm a bit worried about.

Insomnia is starting to fade, restlessness no where near as bad, and the bit of mania I had last week seemed to have passed.  Right now my main issue is memory.  Things I should definitely remember are not foggy like when on opiates, but more like just absent.  Hoping I didn't do any permanent damage and it will come back.  Second issue is my guts.  I have like 3 out of 10 nausea all day and haven't had a solid movement in 10 days
I have the worst headache of my life achey and chilly, when I'm not feeling on fire.  My guts also are, not great.
could this be a symptom of PAWS?
